summary: Alan B. Hausman was an employee of the Select Committee on Assassinations (SCAS). He is listed in multiple payroll and certification reports from 1978 and 1979. These documents detail his employment, salary, and position within the committee during its investigation into the JFK assassination. The documents provide a timeline of his employment with the committee, spanning from at least April 1978 to January 1979.
significance: Alan B. Hausman's significance lies in his employment with the Select Committee on Assassinations, indicating his involvement in the investigation into the JFK assassination. The documents suggest he was a staff member involved in the administrative or investigative work of the committee.
